meanings.definition: Unable to be taken away or transferred.
meanings.sent1: Freedom is an unalienable right that cannot be removed.
meanings.sent2: The Constitution guarantees our unalienable freedoms.
meanings.sent3: It's like trying to take the color out of a rainbow - unalienable!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an unalienable part of her charm.
meanings.sent5: The bond between mother and child is unalienable and strong.

meanings.definition: Inherent; not to be separated from.
meanings.sent1: His unalienable talent for music was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent2: The love for her family was unalienable and unwavering.
meanings.sent3: His unalienable clumsiness always led to funny situations.
meanings.sent4: The unalienable connection between siblings is truly special.
meanings.sent5: The unalienable beauty of the sunset took her breath away.
